Culture.name: {=aom_erebor_name}Dwarves
Culture.text: {=aom_erebor_desc}The Longbeards of Erebor are a proud and industrious race, dwelling in the halls of the Lonely Mountain. Masters of craftsmanship and mining, they are renowned for their skill in forging weapons, armor, and treasures of unrivaled beauty. Led by their King under the Mountain, the dwarves of Erebor are a resilient people, fiercely protective of their homeland and its riches.

Culture.name: {=aom_rivendell_name}Ñoldor Elves
Culture.text: {=aom_rivendell_desc}The Noldor Elves of Rivendell are a wise and ancient people, renowned for their unmatched knowledge, artistry, and valor. Under the guidance of Lord Elrond, they preserve the fading beauty and lore of the Elder Days within the hidden sanctuary of Imladris. Masters of both the sword and the bow, the Noldor combine martial skill with the grace and precision of their kind.

Culture.name: {=aom_mirkwood_name}Silvan Elves
Culture.text: {=aom_mirkwood_desc}The Silvan Elves of Mirkwood, also known as the Woodland Realm, are a proud and resilient people who call the vast forest their home. Ruled by King Thranduil, they are skilled hunters and warriors, navigating the shadowed woods with unmatched agility and precision. The Mirkwood Elves are masters of the bow, striking swiftly and silently from the trees.

Culture.name: {=aom_lothlorien_name}Galadhrim Elves
Culture.text: {=aom_lothlorien_desc}The Elves of Lothlórien, known as the Galadhrim, are a noble and enigmatic people dwelling in the Golden Wood. Guided by the wisdom and power of Lady Galadriel and Lord Celeborn, they are guardians of one of the last bastions of elven beauty and tranquility in Middle-earth. The Galadhrim are unmatched archers, blending seamlessly with the golden Mallorn trees of their homeland.

Culture.name: {=aom_isengard_name}Isengard
Culture.text: {=aom_isengard_desc}The people of Isengard are Saruman's legions, forged through industry and fueled by a dark vision of domination. Centered around the impenetrable tower of Orthanc, Isengard is home to the Uruk-hai, bred for strength, endurance, and obedience. With machines of war and the cunning of their master, they crush all opposition with ruthless precision.

Culture.name: {=aom_gundabad_name}Gundabad Orcs
Culture.text: {=aom_gundabad_desc}The Gundabad Orcs of the Misty Mountains are savage and relentless. From the ancient stronghold of Mount Gundabad, they raid the surrounding lands, driven by a thirst for vengeance and conquest. Under the rule of powerful chieftains, they amass legions of goblins, wargs, and trolls. Gundabad's warriors are brutish and cunning, masters of ambush and overwhelming force.

Culture.name: {=aom_umbar_name}Umbar
Culture.text: {=aom_umbar_desc}The people of Umbar are seafaring warriors and corsairs, masters of the seas south of Gondor. Descended from Númenórean exiles, they are known for their cunning and ferocity in battle. Under black sails, their fleets raid the coasts, striking fear into the hearts of their enemies. While their allegiances lie with Sauron, the Corsairs of Umbar are fiercely independent, valuing strength and cunning above all.

Culture.name: {=aom_dolguldur_name}Dol Guldur Orcs
Culture.text: {=aom_dolguldur_desc}Dol Guldur is a fortress of shadow and malice. Once a stronghold of Sauron in Mirkwood, it is now ruled by the Necromancer's dark lieutenants. The armies of Dol Guldur are a fearsome blend of orcs, wargs, and dark sorcery. This bastion of evil corrupts the forest around it, spreading decay and despair. The warriors of Dol Guldur are relentless, driven by the will of their dark master.

Culture.name: {=aom_gondor_name}Gondorian
Culture.text: {=aom_gondor_desc}The people of Gondor are a proud and resilient folk, heirs to the greatest kingdom of Men in Middle-earth. Founded by the Númenórean exiles Isildur and Anárion, Gondor stands as a bastion of strength and hope against the encroaching darkness of Mordor. Its stone cities, crowned by the majestic Minas Tirith, are marvels of engineering and endurance. Guided by noble stewards and valiant captains, they field disciplined armies of steadfast infantry and swift mounted knights, a shining beacon of defiance in the face of despair.

Culture.name: {=aom_mordor_name}Mordor
Culture.text: {=aom_mordor_desc}The Orcs of Mordor are a brutal and relentless force, bred in the dark pits of Barad-dûr to serve the will of Sauron. Cruel and savage, they march to war in endless hordes, wielding crude but deadly weapons forged in the fires of Mount Doom. Clad in jagged armor and bearing black banners emblazoned with the Red Eye, they bring fear and destruction wherever they tread. Bound by the iron will of their Dark Lord, the Orcs of Mordor are divided into warbands led by ruthless captains, united only in their desire for conquest.
